intro: Sclarea nemorosa, commonly known as the wood anemone, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands. The plant features a basal rosette of heart-shaped leaves and produces white, bell-shaped flowers with five petals. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes buttercups and other similar plants. Sclarea nemorosa is known for its early spring bloom and is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its preference for undisturbed habitats.
